item.title: The weekend in pictures
item.trailText: A selection of the best pictures from around the world this weekend
item.standFirst: A selection of the best pictures from around the world this weekend including police patrols in Tunisia and the world’s largest Einstein gathering

displayImages.caption: Sousse, Tunisia Armed police on horseback patrol Marhaba beach where 38 people were killed in a gun attack Photograph: Jeff J Mitchell/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Armed police on horseback patrol Marhaba beach in Sousse, Tunisia
displayImages.cleanCaption: Sousse, Tunisia Armed police on horseback patrol Marhaba beach where 38 people were killed in a gun attack

displayImages.caption: Los Angeles, US Benny Wasserman, centre, stands in a crowd of people dressed as Albert Einstein as they gather to establish a Guinness world record for the largest Einstein gathering, to raise money for School on Wheels and homeless children’s education Photograph: Lucy Nicholson/Reuters
displayImages.altText: Crowd gathers for Guinness world record attempt at largest Albert Einstein gathering
displayImages.cleanCaption: Los Angeles, US Benny Wasserman, centre, stands in a crowd of people dressed as Albert Einstein as they gather to establish a Guinness world record for the largest Einstein gathering, to raise money for School on Wheels and homeless children’s education

displayImages.caption: Illaiserr Manyatta, Kenya, Maasai morans dance a day after the inauguration ceremony of a new Iltuati age group leader. Age groups are the central units of Maasai society and each leader is appointed through elaborate rituals and given various decision-making authorities to lead his group Photograph: Daniel Irungu/EPA
displayImages.altText: Maasai morans dance a day after the inauguration ceremony of a new Iltuati age group leader
displayImages.cleanCaption: Illaiserr Manyatta, Kenya, Maasai morans dance a day after the inauguration ceremony of a new Iltuati age group leader. Age groups are the central units of Maasai society and each leader is appointed through elaborate rituals and given various decision-making authorities to lead his group

displayImages.caption: Athens, Greece A security worker brings money to a National Bank branch. The country faces a default that could push it out of the euro and cause ripple effects across the European economy Photograph: Marko Djurica/Reuters
displayImages.altText: A security worker brings money to a National Bank branch in Athens
displayImages.cleanCaption: Athens, Greece A security worker brings money to a National Bank branch. The country faces a default that could push it out of the euro and cause ripple effects across the European economy

displayImages.caption: Seoul, South Korea Anti-gay Christian activists beat drums during a gay pride event held as part of the Korea Queer Festival. Gay and transgender Koreans live largely under the radar in a country that remains deeply conservative about matters of sexual identity Photograph: Ed Jones/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Seoul, south Korea Anti-gay Christian activists beat drums during a gay pride event held as part of the Korea Queer Festival in Seoul
displayImages.cleanCaption: Seoul, South Korea Anti-gay Christian activists beat drums during a gay pride event held as part of the Korea Queer Festival. Gay and transgender Koreans live largely under the radar in a country that remains deeply conservative about matters of sexual identity

displayImages.caption: Bujumbura, Burundi A man grabs the barrel of a gun from a policeman during a scuffle with residents angered by a search operation Photograph: Marco Longari/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Men fight over a gun in Bujumbara, Burundi
displayImages.cleanCaption: Bujumbura, Burundi A man grabs the barrel of a gun from a policeman during a scuffle with residents angered by a search operation

displayImages.caption: New Taipei City, Taiwan A waterpark in the Pali district where more than 500 people were injured when a fireball ripped through a crowd Photograph: Sam Yeh/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: A waterpark in the Pali district of New Taipei City
displayImages.cleanCaption: New Taipei City, Taiwan A waterpark in the Pali district where more than 500 people were injured when a fireball ripped through a crowd

displayImages.altText: Revellers stand with their feet wrapped in gaffer tape at the OpenAir St Gallen music festival
displayImages.cleanCaption: St Gallen, Switzerland Revellers stand with their feet wrapped in gaffer tape at the OpenAir St Gallen music festival

displayImages.altText: Teenagers from a boxing school take part in a training session in the Caspian Sea

displayImages.caption: Petaluma, California, US A Chinese Crested dog named Sweepee Rambo is presented to judges during the World’s Ugliest Dog Competition – it didn’t win Photograph: Josh Edelson/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: A Chinese Crested dog named Sweepee Rambo,  is presented to judges during the World's Ugliest Dog Competition

displayImages.caption: Paris, France Lanvin presents its spring/summer 2016 menswear collection at men’s Fashion Week Photograph: Etienne Laurent/EPA

displayImages.cleanCaption: Paris, France Lanvin presents its spring/summer 2016 menswear collection at men’s Fashion Week

displayImages.caption: Suruc, Turkey A Syrian Kurdish boy climbs on to the window of a house near the border with Syria. Kurdish forces have driven Isis fighters from Kobane Photograph: Bulent Kilic/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: A Syrian Kurdish boy climbs on to the window of a house near the border with Syria
displayImages.cleanCaption: Suruc, Turkey A Syrian Kurdish boy climbs on to the window of a house near the border with Syria. Kurdish forces have driven Isis fighters from Kobane

displayImages.caption: Middelkerke, Belgium A bus lies on its side after crashing with 34 schoolchildren and teachers on board on Sunday morning, killing the driver Photograph: Eric Vidal/Reuters
displayImages.altText: Bus lies on its side after crash in Middelkirke, Belgium
displayImages.cleanCaption: Middelkerke, Belgium A bus lies on its side after crashing with 34 schoolchildren and teachers on board on Sunday morning, killing the driver

displayImages.caption: Rakov, Belarus People take part in the Ivan Kupala festival, originating from pagan times. They sing and dance around campfires, believing it will purge them of their sins and make them healthier Photograph: Vasily Fedosenko/Reuters
